page.title: 18LYMM DAM
page.content: Lymm Dam is a man made lake. It was formed when the Warrington to Altrincham Road was built across Bradley Brook. A dam was constructed with sluices allowing the water to pass through. The land around was owned by Lord Leverhuhue who planted woodland and landscaped the area early in the century. In recent years the pathways and steep slopes have been improved and there is now also a Park Ranger Service. The Rangers have a club for children. On Saturdays to go on nature walks around the Dam. It takes about half an hour to stroll through the pleasant woods around the lake and it is a local tourist attraction. The main recreational activity is fishing, where Lymm Anglers compete. Swimming is prohibited.
